sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"剧烈的，凶猛的，狂暴的"之意。
means: turbulent ： 正式用词，多用描写风和水，也可指心神不定或控制不住的感情波动。
stormy ： 指风雨大作，也指人很激动的感情。
violent ： 普通用词，指人时侧重极为不安，异常激，暗含有达或暴力行为；也指破坏性的或不可控制的自然力量。
wild ： 普通用词，既可指自然界的荒芜，未被驯化状态，又指人的无法无天，不文明的野蛮行为。
fierce ： 普通用词，指人或兽的凶猛残酷。

sentence.Network_en: The seas grew turbulent, tossing the small boat like a cork.
sentence.Network_cn: 海浪变得汹涌澎湃，把小船像漂浮的软木塞一样抛来甩去。

sentence.Network_en: a short and turbulent career in politics
The present international situation remains tense and turbulent.
sentence.Network_cn: 当前的国际局势依然紧张动荡.

英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... turbine n 涡轮 turbulent a 骚乱的 turbulence n 骚乱.

新东方六级高频词汇整理_百度文库 ... trivial a. 琐碎的，不重要的 turbulent a. 动荡的，混乱的 underlying a. 潜在的.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin turbulentus 'full of commotion', from turba 'crowd'

entry.tran: 变幻莫测的;动荡的;骚乱的;混乱的
entry.def: A turbulent time, place, or relationship is one in which there is a lot of change, confusion, and disorder.

example.ex: They had been together for five or six turbulent years of rows and reconciliations...
example.tran: 他们在一起生活了五六年，一直吵吵闹闹，分分合合，没有片刻安宁。

example.ex: The turbulent world of Middle Eastern politics defies prediction.
example.tran: 中东动荡不安的政治局势让人难以预测。

entry.def: Turbulent water or air contains strong currents which change direction suddenly.

example.ex: I had to have a boat that could handle turbulent seas.
example.tran: 我必须有一艘能经得起狂风骇浪的船。

means.word_mean: 1. characterized by unrest or disorder or insubordination;

sentences.sentence: "effects of the struggle will be violent and disruptive"

means.word_mean: 2. (of a liquid) agitated vigorously; in a state of turbulence;

auth_sentence.res_content: Who will rid me of this turbulent priest?

stems_affixes.word_buile: turb搅动,混乱+id表形容词→搅动的→混浊的
turb搅动,混乱+ulent多……的→adj.狂暴的,无秩序的
im不+perturb[n.烦乱,扰乱]+able……的→不受扰乱[影响]
disturb[v.扰乱,妨碍,使不安]+ance表名词→n.动乱,骚乱,干扰
perturb[n.烦乱,扰乱]+ation表名词→n.动摇, 混乱

stems_affixes.value_cn: 骚动;强烈而不稳定的气流/水流

stems_affixes.word_buile: turb搅动,混乱+ine物,机器等→n.汽轮机,涡轮机
tur=turb搅动,混乱+moil翻腾→搅动,翻腾→混乱
dis分开+turb搅动,混乱→搅开了→搅乱了

jushi.english: This has been a turbulent week for the government.
jushi.chinese: 对政府来讲，这是一个骚乱的星期。

jushi.english: The sea was too turbulent for us to be able to take the boat out.
jushi.chinese: 大海波涛汹涌，我们无法出海。
